document.docAuthor: Antić, Dragan Ž. & Makarov, Slobodan E.
document.masterDocTitle: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

heading.emphasis:
Caucasominorus polylobatus
gen. et sp. nov.

Posterolateral view. E. Posterior view. F. Distal view. cp = coxal process; hs = hairy structure; ll = lateral lamella; lo = lobe; ml = mesal lamella; pl = posterior lamella; rs = row of setae; sp = sternal plate; ss = sternal sac; ws = wing-like structure; ppr = posterior projection; sls = setae-like structure.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Differs from
C. billi
gen. et sp. nov. by the almost completely smooth shields of the anterior gonopods, and by the presence of more numerous knife-like lobes on the coxal processes of the posterior gonopods.
Etymology. To emphasize the presence of several knife-like lobes on the coxal processes of the posterior gonopods.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Body with 31 segments (including telson) in adults.
MEASUREMENTS. Males 8–10 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 0.7–0.8 mm . Females 8.5–11.5 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 0.7–0.9 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 48.
Caucasominorus polylobatus
gen. et sp. nov. , male from Stepanavan, Armenia, habitus. Scale line = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: HEAD . Slightly concave in males. Labrum with three medial teeth and 5+2 labral and 2+1 supralabral setae in paratype male. Promentum triangular, without setae. Lingual plates with 5+5 setae, on each plate arranged in two rows. Stipites with ca 27+27 setae. Antennae 1.2 mm long in paratype male. Length of antennomeres (in mm): I (0.05), II (0.14), III (0.3), IV (0.16), V (0.3), VI (0.15), VII (0.09) and VIII (0.01). Length/breadth ratios of antennomeres I–VII: I (0.07), II (1.8), III (3.8), IV (2), V (3), VI (1.5) and VII (1.1). Antennomeres II, IV, V, VI and VII with one, three, one, four and one sensillum, respectively. Number of ocelli 16–20, arranged in 5 rows in both sexes.
COLLUM. Narrower than head, with six macrochaetae. Anterior edge semi-circular, posterior margin gently concave.

BODY SEGMENTS ( Figs 48 , 49 A–D). Lateral keels like lateral swellings. Macrochaetae relatively long and trichoid. CIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 0.8; MIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 2.1; PIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 0.45; MA (pleurotergite 15) ~ 95˚.
TELSON. Epiproct with a pair of spinnerets and 3+3 setae (1+1 paramedian, 2+2 marginal). Hypoproct with 1+1 apical setae. Paraprocts with 3+3 marginal setae.
WALKING LEGS . In both sexes, leg-pairs 1 and 2 with tarsal combs; prefemora with several long and robust setae; femora and postfemora with a group of several long and robust setae.

MALE SEXUAL CHARACTERS ( Fig. 50 ). Leg-pairs 3–7 enlarged. Leg-pairs 3 and 4 each with a basal exterior protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pair 5 with a basal oral protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pair 6 without peculiarities. Legpair 7 with a posterior coxal horn. Leg-pair 10 with coxal glands and a short coxal process. Leg-pair 11 with coxal glands and a posterior coxal horn.

caption.paragraph:

Caucasominorus polylobatus
gen. et sp. nov. , male from Stepanavan, Armenia. A. Pleurotergites 14 and 15, posterior view. B. Pleurotergites 14 and 15, lateral view. C. Pleurotergites 14 and 15, dorsal view. D. Posterior gonopods, anterior view. c = coxite; t = telopodites; b1 = short mesal process; b2 = crestlike process; cv = coxal vesicle; ks = knife-like lobes.

FIGURE 50.
Caucasominorus polylobatus
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype male. A. Leg 3. B. Leg 4. C. Leg 7. D. Leg 10. E. Leg 11. Scale lines = 0.2 mm.
